title: Shortest String That Contains Three Strings
description:
Given three strings a, b, and c, your task is to find a string that has the minimum length and contains all three strings as substrings.
If there are multiple such strings, return the lexicographically smallest one.
Return a string denoting the answer to the problem.
Notes

A string a is lexicographically smaller than a string b (of the same length) if in the first position where a and b differ, string a has a letter that appears earlier in the alphabet than the corresponding letter in b.
A substring is a contiguous sequence of characters within a string.

 
Example 1:

Input: a = "abc", b = "bca", c = "aaa"
Output: "aaabca"
Explanation:  We show that "aaabca" contains all the given strings: a = ans[2...4], b = ans[3..5], c = ans[0..2]. It can be shown that the length of the resulting string would be at least 6 and "aaabca" is the lexicographically smallest one.
Example 2:

Input: a = "ab", b = "ba", c = "aba"
Output: "aba"
Explanation: We show that the string "aba" contains all the given strings: a = ans[0..1], b = ans[1..2], c = ans[0..2]. Since the length of c is 3, the length of the resulting string would be at least 3. It can be shown that "aba" is the lexicographically smallest one.

 
Constraints:

1 <= a.length, b.length, c.length <= 100
a, b, c consist only of lowercase English letters.
starter_code:
class Solution:
    def minimumString(self, a: str, b: str, c: str) -> str:
preamble:

check_function:
def check(candidate):
    assert candidate(a = "aaaa",b = "bbbb",c = "cccc") == "aaaabbbbcccc"
    assert candidate(a = "aaa",b = "aa",c = "a") == "aaa"
    assert candidate(a = "ab",b = "ba",c = "aba") == "aba"
    assert candidate(a = "hello",b = "world",c = "hold") == "helloholdworld"
